Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Eumenitin-F (natural AMPs; Mastoparan, Leu-rich, insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (93.33%) toRumenitinL: 33%, K: 20%.Activity: Active against Gram+ S-aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC >60 uM), S. epidermidis clinical sample (MIC 30 uM), M. luteus ATCC 10240 (MIC 30 uM), S. pyogenes clinical sample (MIC 30 uM), B. subtilis ATCC 6633 (MIC 30 uM), Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 30 uM), P-mirabilis clinical sample (MIC >60 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 30 uM), S. maltophilia ATCC 13637 (MIC 15 uM), yeast C. albicans ATCC 90112 (MIC 7.5 uM).In vitro toxicity: human RBC: HC50 157.1 uM; rat RBC: HC50  207.1 uM. Less hemo.lytic.Structure:  random coil in tris buffer and helical in 8 mM SDS, 40% TFE, or 250 asolectin (lipids).Updated 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Rangel M, Cabrera MP, Kazuma K, Ando K, Wang X, Kato M, Nihei K, Hirata IY, Cross TJ, Garcia AN, Faquim-Mauro EL, Franzolin MR, Fuchino H, Mori-Yasumoto K, Sekita S, Kadowaki M, Satake M, Konno K. 2011
Literature Information.Title: Chemical and biological characterization of four new linear cationic alpha-helical peptides from the venoms of two solitary eumenine wasps.
